Ultrasound Services

Ultrasound, or sonography, is a non-invasive imaging technique that uses sound waves to create detailed images of internal organs, tissues, and blood flow. It is widely used for diagnostic, monitoring, and screening purposes.

Common Ultrasound Examinations

  • Obstetric Ultrasound (Pregnancy monitoring)
  • Abdominal Ultrasound (Liver, kidneys, gallbladder, pancreas)
  • Pelvic Ultrasound (Uterus and ovaries)
  • Thyroid Ultrasound
  • Breast Ultrasound
  • Vascular or Doppler Ultrasound
Note: Ultrasound is safe, painless, and does not use radiation — making it ideal for pregnant women and regular health monitoring.

Benefits of Ultrasound

- Early detection of diseases
- Monitoring fetal growth and development
- Assisting in guided procedures (like biopsies)
- Assessing organ structure and blood flow

Preparation and Procedure

Depending on the type of ultrasound, patients may need to fast or have a full bladder. The procedure typically takes 15–30 minutes and provides immediate results for your doctor’s review.
